template.title: Title of the strength
template.description: Detailed description of what makes this a strength
template.evidence: Evidence from testing that demonstrates this strength
template.context: When this strength is most valuable

entries.title: Clean API design
entries.description: The Stage API is intuitive and well-documented
entries.evidence: Built baseline pipeline in under 30 minutes

entries.title: Clean API design
entries.description: The Stage API is intuitive and well-documented
entries.evidence: Built baseline pipeline in under 30 minutes

entries.title: OutputBag asyncio.Lock protects concurrent writes
entries.description: The async write() method in OutputBag is properly protected by asyncio.Lock(), preventing race conditions during concurrent writes. Multiple parallel stages can safely write to OutputBag without corrupting state.
entries.evidence: Stress tests with 20 parallel writers writing 10 outputs each (200 total writes) completed successfully with no data corruption or inconsistent state.

entries.title: ContextSnapshot handles 200MB+ payloads successfully
entries.description: Successfully serialized and deserialized a 209MB ContextSnapshot with 10000 messages and 100 documents
entries.evidence: Test with 10,000 messages (10KB each) and 100 documents (100KB each) completed successfully

entries.title: Strong context isolation in subpipeline spawning
entries.description: Child contexts are properly isolated from parent contexts. When a child pipeline modifies its own data dict, the parent context remains unchanged. This prevents the critical amnesia failure mode described in the mission brief.
entries.evidence: H3 test passed: parent_ctx.data remained unchanged after child_ctx.data was modified. Parallel fork test passed: parent_has_child_data was false for all 50 parallel forks.

entries.title: No race conditions in parallel context writes
entries.description: When multiple parallel operations write to the context data dict, all writes are preserved. This was tested with 50 parallel forks and concurrent writes, with zero lost updates.
entries.evidence: H2 stress test: 50 parallel writes all preserved with unique values. Race condition adversarial test: expected 200 counter increments, got exactly 200 with 0 lost updates.

entries.title: Tenant isolation maintained in subpipeline contexts
entries.description: Child pipelines cannot access or corrupt another tenant data. This is critical for multi-tenant deployments in regulated industries.
entries.evidence: Adversarial tenant isolation test: child context for Tenant A could not access Tenant B data. isolation_breached was false.

entries.title: Retry and recovery mechanisms work correctly
entries.description: StageOutput.retry() works correctly for retry logic, and state recovery properly restores context after failures. Recovery test verified that after simulated failures, state is restored to original values.
entries.evidence: Recovery test: RetryableStage correctly failed 2 times then succeeded on 3rd attempt. State recovery test verified data dict returned to original state after modifications.

entries.title: UUIDv4 collision resistance verified at scale
entries.description: Testing confirmed that UUIDv4 generation maintains zero collisions across 100,000+ generations. The cryptographic random UUID generation is robust for high-scale deployments.
entries.evidence: Generated 100,000 UUIDs with zero collisions. Additionally tested 10,000 context generations with zero ID collisions.
entries.context: CORE-004 stress-testing of UUID collision resistance

entries.title: Immutable snapshot design prevents corruption
entries.description: The immutable nature of ContextSnapshot ensures that stage modifications cannot corrupt original state. Modified data is always created through new outputs rather than mutating the snapshot.
entries.evidence: Test verify_snapshot confirmed original_preserved=true even after modify_snapshot added new fields

entries.title: ContextSnapshot serialization integrity
entries.description: ContextSnapshot correctly serializes and deserializes all 23 fields without data loss. JSON round-trip preserves all fields including nested objects like run_id, conversation, enrichments, and metadata.
entries.evidence: Test serialization_roundtrip passed with original_fields=23, restored_fields=23, missing_fields=[]

entries.title: Prior outputs accessible across stage dependencies
entries.description: StageInputs.get() correctly retrieves prior stage outputs, enabling proper data flow through pipeline stages.
entries.evidence: Prior output access test verified all 5 checks: prior_output_accessible, context_captured_accessible, original_input_accessible, modification_accessible, all_expected

entries.title: Correct deep context propagation across 3+ nesting levels
entries.description: Context properly propagates through multiple nesting levels with all identity fields preserved and parent chain maintained correctly.
entries.evidence: Deep nesting test with 4 levels (0-3) passed all tests: all_run_ids_unique, identity_preserved_level_1/2/3, topology_overrides_work, parent_chain_intact

entries.title: Clean Stage API design
entries.description: Creating custom stages in Stageflow is intuitive and straightforward. The Stage base class with name, kind, and execute method pattern is well-designed.
entries.evidence: Built baseline, stress, and chaos pipelines with custom stages in under 2 hours

entries.title: ContextSnapshot frozen dataclass provides strong immutability guarantees
entries.description: The frozen=True, slots=True dataclass prevents direct attribute mutation, correctly raising FrozenInstanceError on mutation attempts
entries.evidence: Immutability verification test passed - mutation attempts correctly raised FrozenInstanceError

entries.title: OutputBag thread-safe concurrent writes
entries.description: The OutputBag.write method uses async lock to serialize concurrent writes, preventing data loss in parallel stage execution
entries.evidence: Stress test with 50 parallel writers x 10 iterations = 500 writes, all 50 writers present in each iteration with zero data loss

entries.title: ContextSnapshot.with_run_id creates proper isolation
entries.description: The with_run_id() method creates new ContextSnapshot instances with new run IDs, maintaining parent-child isolation in forked contexts
entries.evidence: Context isolation test verified parent_run_id != child_run_id in all 30 concurrent fork operations

entries.title: ContextSnapshot.to_dict() enables delta compression
entries.description: The to_dict() method on ContextSnapshot produces JSON-serializable output that can be used for delta computation. This makes it straightforward to implement delta compression between snapshots.
entries.evidence: Successfully computed deltas between context snapshots using to_dict() output

entries.title: org_id preserved in forked contexts
entries.description: PipelineContext.fork() correctly inherits org_id from parent to child context while generating unique pipeline_run_id
entries.evidence: test_subpipeline_org_propagation passed - child_ctx.org_id == parent_org and child_ctx.parent_run_id == parent_ctx.pipeline_run_id

entries.title: TenantContext validation blocks cross-tenant access
entries.description: TenantContext.validate_access() correctly raises TenantIsolationError when attempting to access resources from different tenants
entries.evidence: test_tenant_context_isolation passed - cross-tenant access was blocked with appropriate error

entries.title: Context variable isolation functions work correctly
entries.description: set_current_tenant(), get_current_tenant(), and clear_current_tenant() properly isolate tenant state across async boundaries
entries.evidence: test_context_variables_isolation passed - tenants correctly isolated and cleared

entries.title: CycleDetectedError API
entries.description: CycleDetectedError is properly integrated into Stageflow's pipeline validation system, inheriting from PipelineValidationError
entries.evidence: Test 3 passed - CycleDetectedError is available and properly structured

entries.title: Pipeline linting
entries.description: lint_pipeline() function enables pre-execution validation of pipeline structure for cycle detection
entries.evidence: Test 4 passed - lint_pipeline function is available

entries.title: OutputBag correctly preserves all parallel stage outputs
entries.description: Stageflow correctly handles concurrent writes to the OutputBag from parallel stages. All 50 parallel stages in high fan-out test had their outputs preserved.
entries.evidence: test_high_fanout passed with 50 parallel stages, all outputs captured correctly

entries.title: Clean DAG-based parallel execution model
entries.description: Stageflow provides an intuitive DAG-based execution model where stages automatically execute in parallel when their dependencies are satisfied. This makes it easy to build complex pipelines without manually managing concurrency.
entries.evidence: Successfully built multiple test pipelines with fan-out/fan-in patterns. The framework handled all parallel scheduling automatically without additional code.

entries.title: Excellent 500+ parallel fan-out performance
entries.description: Stageflow successfully executed 502 parallel stages (500 worker + root + aggregation) with 100% success rate and throughput of 2600-2900 stages/second. Memory overhead was minimal (1MB peak growth for 500 stages).
entries.evidence: stress_500 test: 502/502 successful in 0.19s (2596 stages/sec), memory peak_delta_mb: 1.09

entries.title: Race condition resilience
entries.description: 500 parallel stages writing to shared state completed without data corruption or race conditions. All 500 unique keys were correctly written and verified.
entries.evidence: adversarial_race test: 500 unique keys written, 0 conflicts detected

entries.title: Latency injection handling
entries.description: System maintained high throughput (2705 stages/sec) even with 50ms latency injection per stage, demonstrating resilience to variable processing times.
entries.evidence: stress_500_latency test: 502/502 successful with 50ms latency injection, still achieving 2705 stages/sec

entries.title: Successful 1000-stage execution
entries.description: Stageflow successfully executed a pipeline with 1000 sequential stages
entries.evidence: All 1000 stages completed successfully with 0 failures
entries.context: DAG-006 stress testing - linear pipeline with 1000 TRANSFORM stages

entries.title: Memory-efficient deep pipelines
entries.description: Memory stayed bounded at 0.43MB with 1000 stages
entries.evidence: Peak memory was 0.43MB - well under 1MB

entries.title: Linear performance scaling
entries.description: Per-stage latency remains consistent as pipeline depth increases
entries.evidence: Per-stage time: 100 stages=0.51ms, 500=0.54ms, 1000=0.66ms, 2000=0.88ms

entries.title: Extreme pipeline support (2000 stages)
entries.description: Stageflow successfully executed 2000 sequential stages in 1753ms
entries.evidence: All 2000 stages completed successfully
entries.context: DAG-006 stress testing - exceeded target by 2x

entries.title: Baseline pipeline execution is robust
entries.description: Static pipelines execute correctly with all stages completing successfully
entries.evidence: 5/5 stages executed successfully in baseline test

entries.title: Conditional branching works correctly
entries.description: Stageflow ROUTE stages correctly implement conditional branching based on context
entries.evidence: All branch decisions correctly routed based on input values

entries.title: Conditional stage skipping works correctly
entries.description: The conditional=True parameter on stages combined with StageOutput.skip() correctly marks stages as skipped. Downstream stages that depend on skipped stages can still execute and access the skipped stage output.
entries.evidence: Tested with Pipeline().with_stage("skip", Stage, conditional=True) where stage returned StageOutput.skip(reason=...). The skip stage was marked SKIP and downstream stages executed correctly.

entries.title: Router stage pattern works correctly
entries.description: Stages with StageKind.ROUTE can evaluate conditions and produce routing outputs. The routing decision is accessible to downstream stages via ctx.inputs.
entries.evidence: Created RouterStage with kind=StageKind.ROUTE that evaluates input values and returns route=high/low/default. Downstream stages can access this via ctx.inputs.get_from("router", "route").

entries.title: Parallel execution with merge works correctly
entries.description: Multiple stages can execute in parallel after their dependencies resolve. The merge stage correctly receives outputs from all parallel branches.
entries.evidence: Tested diamond pattern with parallel_a and parallel_b executing concurrently. Merge stage correctly aggregated results from both.

entries.title: High concurrency performance
entries.description: Stageflow handles 100+ concurrent pipeline executions with 100% success rate and acceptable latency degradation
entries.evidence: Tested 100 concurrent pipelines with 4 stages each - all 100 completed successfully, p95 latency 360ms

entries.title: Pydantic validation performance is excellent
entries.description: Pydantic v2 validation adds negligible overhead (~0.005ms per validation) with 200K+ validations/sec throughput. This makes typed output validation practical for high-throughput pipelines.
entries.evidence: Benchmarked 1000 validations: avg 0.005ms, p99 0.011ms, 199K/sec throughput

entries.title: Clear and actionable validation error messages
entries.description: Pydantic v2 provides detailed validation errors that clearly indicate which field failed, what was expected, and what was received. This significantly aids debugging.
entries.evidence: Tested error messages for confidence bounds, empty results, type coercion - all provide specific error details

entries.title: Clean StageInputs API for field access
entries.description: The StageInputs API provides intuitive methods for accessing stage outputs (get, get_from, require_from) with proper validation. Missing fields return None gracefully, and explicit dependency access through get_from prevents accidental coupling.
entries.evidence: Successfully tested field access patterns: ctx.inputs.get("field") returns None for missing fields, ctx.inputs.get_from("stage", "field") provides explicit dependency access, and strict mode catches undeclared dependencies early.

entries.title: UnifiedPipelineCancelled preserves partial results
entries.description: When a stage returns StageOutput.cancel(), the pipeline gracefully stops and UnifiedPipelineCancelled includes a results dict with all completed stage outputs.
entries.evidence: Pipeline A -> B where B cancels provides e.results containing As output

entries.title: CycleDetectedError provides cycle path visualization
entries.description: CycleDetectedError shows the exact cycle path with arrow notation (stage_a -> stage_b -> stage_c -> stage_a), making it easy to identify the circular dependency. This is the best example of contextual error messaging in Stageflow.
entries.evidence: Error message clearly visualizes the cycle, scoring 1.75/3.0 overall - highest among tested error types

entries.title: GUARD stages effectively catch validation failures
entries.description: GUARD stages provide an effective mechanism for implementing validation checks. When a required field is missing and the stage explicitly checks for it, the GUARD correctly fails and stops the pipeline.
entries.evidence: Test 3 showed that a GUARD stage with explicit validation correctly detected a missing required field and failed with an appropriate error message.

entries.title: Proper error handling for invalid nested path access
entries.description: When attempting to navigate to a nested path that does not exist (e.g., accessing field.nested.where it should be dict), Stageflow properly raises a StageExecutionError with a clear error message.
entries.evidence: Test case attempting to access top_level.nested.does_not_exist properly failed with: Cannot navigate path: top_level is not a dict

entries.title: GUARD stage provides solid validation foundation
entries.description: The GUARD stage kind is well-designed for validation. Its explicit purpose (validate/filter), natural placement in pipelines, and integration with StageOutput makes it a good foundation for building validation patterns.
entries.evidence: Successfully implemented validation stages using GUARD kind with clear separation from transformation logic.

entries.title: ContextSnapshot inheritance through subpipeline fork() works correctly
entries.description: When a parent pipeline forks a child context via PipelineContext.fork(), all identity fields (user_id, org_id, session_id, etc.) are properly inherited to the child context. This enables correct context propagation in hierarchical pipeline structures.
entries.evidence: Test subpipeline_context_inheritance passed, verifying user_id and org_id are correctly inherited from parent to child pipeline contexts
entries.context: Subpipeline fork() with identity field inheritance

entries.title: Excellent streaming audio primitives
entries.description: Stageflow provides well-designed streaming audio primitives (ChunkQueue, StreamingBuffer) that make building real-time audio pipelines straightforward.
entries.evidence: Built baseline audio pipeline with streaming support in under 30 minutes with minimal boilerplate

entries.title: Schema mapping accuracy is reliable
entries.description: All 16 tests passed including baseline, type coercion, edge cases, and adversarial tests. Field mapping correctly transforms source fields to target schema.
entries.evidence: 100% test success rate across 16 test cases

entries.title: Date format parsing handles diverse formats correctly
entries.description: The DateParseStage using dateutil.parser successfully parsed 16/18 test date formats including ISO 8601, RFC 2822, US, EU, and various human-readable formats. Failures were only for intentional edge cases (relative dates like yesterday).
entries.evidence: Tested 18 different date formats; 16 parsed correctly including ambiguous dates, long month names, and various separators

entries.title: Excellent ISO 8601 timestamp parsing accuracy
entries.description: Stageflow-based timestamp extraction achieved 93.3% success rate on ISO 8601 format variations, demonstrating robust handling of the most important standard format.
entries.evidence: 14/15 ISO 8601 formats parsed successfully including variants with milliseconds, timezones, and different separators.

entries.title: Well-designed streaming primitives with backpressure monitoring
entries.description: Stageflow streaming primitives (ChunkQueue, StreamingBuffer, BackpressureMonitor) provide a well-designed foundation for building real-time data pipelines. The integration of event emitters for telemetry is particularly well done.
entries.evidence: Built comprehensive test suite using ChunkQueue, StreamingBuffer, and BackpressureMonitor with minimal friction. Event emission for telemetry works as documented.

entries.title: Silent failures detectable through output validation
entries.description: StageOutput allows returning success status while embedding incorrect data. This pattern enables detection of silent failures through downstream validation stages. The test successfully identified 5/5 silent failures where a transform stage returned ok status but produced incorrect output.
entries.evidence: Silent failure detection test passed - 5 silent failures were identified where the stage returned ok but produced wrong output (42 instead of expected values)

entries.title: Idempotent operations produce consistent results
entries.description: Multiple executions of the same transform with identical inputs produce identical outputs. This is critical for safe retries and recovery scenarios.
entries.evidence: Idempotency test passed - 3 executions of the same pipeline produced 1 unique result, confirming idempotent behavior
entries.context: Error recovery and partial transform testing

entries.title: Clean Stage protocol design
entries.description: The Stage protocol with execute() method returning StageOutput is intuitive and well-documented. Creating custom stages follows a clear pattern.
entries.evidence: Built QueryDecompositionStage, MultiHopRetrievalStage, ContextSynthesisStage, and AnswerValidationStage following the documented pattern with no issues.

entries.title: ENRICH stage architecture enables clean RAG pipelines
entries.description: The ENRICH stage kind provides a clean abstraction for document retrieval in RAG pipelines. The context snapshot system properly propagates DocumentEnrichment through the pipeline, making it easy to build knowledge-augmented agents.
entries.evidence: Successfully implemented embedding drift testing pipeline with DocumentEnrichment flowing correctly through embedding_drift_test -> validation -> metrics_collection stages
entries.context: Building ENRICH-002 test pipelines for embedding drift and index desync

entries.title: Stageflow architecture enables citation verification extension
entries.description: The Stageflow architecture provides excellent foundations for implementing citation verification. The GUARD stage kind, typed StageOutput contracts, and interceptor patterns provide the necessary extension points to add citation hallucination detection without modifying core framework behavior.
entries.evidence: Successfully implemented CitationVerifierStage using GUARD kind, verified StageInputs provides access to upstream outputs, and emit_event enables observability for verification results.
entries.context: While native citation verification is missing, the framework is well-designed to support it as an extension.

entries.title: Flexible pipeline composition enables version-aware patterns
entries.description: The Pipeline and StageGraph APIs make it straightforward to compose custom stages for version-aware retrieval. The modular design allowed implementing version filtering without modifying core framework code.
entries.evidence: Built a complete version-aware pipeline with retrieval, conflict detection, resolution, and preparation stages in under 200 lines of code.

entries.title: Clean ENRICH stage architecture enables context tracking
entries.description: The ENRICH stage kind is well-designed for adding context-aware behavior. Its position in the pipeline (between GUARD and ROUTE) allows for tracking context state and making intelligent decisions about retrieval strategies.
entries.evidence: Was able to implement comprehensive context boundary tracking with minimal friction. The stage kind separation makes it clear where enrichment logic belongs.

entries.title: Clean separation of concerns in Stage architecture
entries.description: The Stage protocol with separate StageKind enums (ENRICH, TRANSFORM, GUARD, etc.) enables clear separation of concerns. Building GraphRAG stages for different purposes (loading, validation, traversal, synthesis) was intuitive and each stage could focus on a single responsibility.
entries.evidence: Built 6 GraphRAG stages (loader, validator, parser, resolver, traversal, synthesis) each with clear purpose

entries.title: Baseline pipeline execution works correctly
entries.description: The baseline test (no failures injected) completed successfully, demonstrating that Stageflow correctly orchestrates ENRICH stages with proper data flow. The Pipeline built correctly, stages executed in sequence, data was properly passed between stages via StageInputs, and validation stage detected successful completion.
entries.evidence: Baseline test: 5 documents retrieved, validation passed, metrics collected successfully. Pipeline execution completed with status=ok for all stages.

entries.title: Clean separation of concerns in stage architecture
entries.description: The Stage protocol with name, kind, and execute() methods provides a clean, intuitive interface for defining pipeline stages. Type hints and async execution model are well-designed.
entries.evidence: Created working enrichment stages with minimal boilerplate following the documented protocol

entries.title: Semantic chunking preserves sentence boundaries
entries.description: The semantic chunking implementation correctly splits content at sentence boundaries, preserving natural language structure for RAG retrieval.
entries.evidence: Semantic chunking test passed with 4 chunks created from 633 tokens, properly aligned with sentence boundaries

entries.title: Good performance for chunking operations
entries.description: Chunking operations perform well under load with 621 ops/sec throughput and sub-2ms P95 latency for 633-token documents.
entries.evidence: Performance test: 100 iterations, avg 1.61ms, P95 2.04ms, throughput 621 ops/sec

entries.title: Filter operator accuracy for valid operators
entries.description: All standard filter operators (equals, in, contains, gt, lt, gte, range) work correctly with appropriate precision. The metadata filtering mock correctly implements each operator behavior.
entries.evidence: 8 out of 9 baseline tests passed for valid operators. Filter efficiency ranged from 16.7% (equals) to 70.7% (range), demonstrating accurate filtering behavior.

entries.title: Baseline routing accuracy exceeds expectations
entries.description: The ROUTE stage achieved 100% accuracy on baseline tests with both accurate and overconfident calibration modes. The keyword-based routing logic correctly handled all 8 test cases including edge cases.
entries.evidence: All 8 baseline test cases passed: support (login issues, bug fixes), sales (upgrades, pricing), general (hours, check-ins), and escalation (critical security, system down)

entries.title: Clean Pipeline API Design
entries.description: The Pipeline.with_stage() pattern is highly intuitive and allows for fluent pipeline construction. Stage execution is properly isolated and the StageKind enum provides clear categorization.
entries.evidence: Built baseline pipeline in 15 minutes with no confusion. Concurrent execution of 20 requests worked correctly without any additional synchronization code.

entries.title: Consistent Concurrent Behavior
entries.description: Routing decisions remain consistent under concurrent load. No race conditions detected when executing 20 simultaneous routing requests through the same pipeline.
entries.evidence: 20 concurrent requests produced 100% correct routing with uniform route distribution (5 standard, 5 fast, 5 premium, 5 escalation).

entries.title: Circuit Breaker Pattern Implementation
entries.description: The circuit breaker implementation correctly manages CLOSED, OPEN, and HALF_OPEN states with proper transitions on failure and success thresholds
entries.evidence: All circuit breaker state transitions tested successfully: closed -> open after failures, open blocks calls, half_open after timeout, back to closed on success

entries.title: Fallback Router State Tracking
entries.description: The FallbackRouter correctly tracks route history including attempts, routes, and status for each fallback attempt
entries.evidence: Route history correctly shows all attempts with status and latency for each fallback step

entries.title: Deterministic Routing Behavior
entries.description: Routing decisions are deterministic - identical inputs produce identical outputs across multiple executions
entries.evidence: Test showed 5/5 identical routes for same input

entries.title: Multi-criteria routing core functionality works correctly
entries.description: The multi-criteria routing logic correctly evaluates weighted criteria and produces valid routing decisions with appropriate confidence scores.
entries.evidence: 100% success rate across 68 test cases including baseline, stress, chaos, adversarial, and recovery tests

entries.title: Hash-Based Consistent Bucketing
entries.description: The variant assigner correctly implements deterministic bucketing using SHA-256 hashing, ensuring consistent variant assignment for the same user across multiple requests
entries.evidence: Consistency tests pass with same user receiving identical variant across 10 consecutive requests
entries.context: A/B testing requires consistent user experience within an experiment

entries.title: Traffic Split Accuracy
entries.description: Traffic distribution matches expected splits within acceptable tolerance (within 5% for 50/50, within 3% for 80/20 and 90/10)
entries.evidence: Three traffic split tests pass: 50/50 (49.0%), 80/20 (78.8%), 90/10 (89.2%)
entries.context: Accurate traffic splitting is fundamental to A/B test validity

entries.title: Loop detection mechanism works correctly for direct cycles
entries.description: The custom LoopDetector successfully identifies direct cycles (same route repeated) within the configured threshold (3 iterations).
entries.evidence: Direct cycle test passed - detected route_a repeated 3 times

entries.title: State reset functionality works correctly
entries.description: RouterStage.reset() properly resets both the router iteration counter and loop detector state, allowing independent test runs.
entries.evidence: State reset test passed - both runs detected loops independently

entries.title: Max iterations enforcement prevents runaway pipelines
entries.description: The max_iterations parameter correctly limits execution, preventing infinite loops from consuming resources.
entries.evidence: Max iterations test passed - stopped at exactly 10 iterations

entries.title: Multi-layer guard stage architecture
entries.description: The multi-layer GUARD stage design implements defense-in-depth with regex pattern matching, obfuscation detection, and context analysis layers. This architecture aligns with Microsoft and OWASP recommendations for prompt injection defense.
entries.evidence: Created MultiLayerGuardStage with 3 detection layers covering injection patterns, obfuscation techniques, and context manipulation attempts

entries.title: Clean PIIDetector API design
entries.description: The PIIDetector class has an intuitive interface with configurable detection rates, making it easy to test different scenarios.
entries.evidence: Built comprehensive test suite with multiple pipeline configurations in under 2 hours

entries.title: GUARD stage architecture enables clear security boundaries
entries.description: The separation of GUARD stages with explicit policy enforcement points provides clear architecture for security testing
entries.evidence: Built 7 test pipelines (baseline, direct injection, indirect injection, character injection, automated, multi-turn, output guard) demonstrating clear separation of concerns

entries.title: Rate limiter implementations are correct
entries.description: All rate limiting algorithms (Token Bucket, Sliding Window, etc.) correctly enforce limits without silent failures
entries.evidence: Baseline, burst, and stress tests showed correct rate limiting behavior with 0 silent failures across 8200+ requests

entries.title: Excellent performance under stress
entries.description: Rate limiting adds minimal overhead (<1ms) with P99 latency of 71ms at 820 req/s throughput
entries.evidence: Stress test achieved 820 requests/second with P95 latency of 59.75ms and zero errors

entries.title: Clean GuardrailCheck protocol design
entries.description: The GuardrailCheck protocol provides a clean, extensible interface for implementing custom content moderation checks. It is easy to understand and implement custom checks for domain-specific content policies.
entries.evidence: Successfully implemented MockContentFilterCheck and InjectionDetectorCheck following the protocol

entries.title: Stageflow GUARD stage architecture supports adversarial input validation
entries.description: The GUARD stage type in Stageflow is well-suited for implementing input validation pipelines. The StageKind.GUARD enumeration and cancel() method on StageOutput provide clean mechanisms for blocking malicious inputs.
entries.evidence: Successfully implemented InputValidationStage and InjectionDetectionStage using GUARD kind. The cancel() method correctly stops pipeline execution when threats are detected.

entries.title: Guard Stage Architecture Enables Clear Performance Isolation
entries.description: Stageflow GUARD stage architecture cleanly isolates guard logic, making it easy to measure, optimize, and parallelize guard checks independently from business logic.
entries.evidence: Successfully measured guard overhead across 5 pipeline configurations. Guard latency is clearly isolated in stage outputs.

entries.title: Stageflow GUARD stages correctly implement content filtering pipeline
entries.description: The LanguageDetectionStage, ContentFilteringStage, and TranslationStage work correctly together to create a multi-language content filtering pipeline. Clean content passes through (COMPLETED), toxic content is filtered (CANCELLED), and audit logging captures all decisions.
entries.evidence: Pipeline logs show successful execution: clean content reaches COMPLETED status, profanity triggers CANCELLED status with correct filtering reason
entries.context: Testing multi-language content filtering for GUARD-009
